poem:
"Mourning the Scribe"

Ink spilt, words woven from the worldly web,
Terry Coleman, prosaic craftsman at his desk.
Spurring conflicts, unmasking the renowned, you tread,
Guardian of truth, never settling for less.

The deference crumbles, your candid spirit alive,
Conversations - battles, you so deftly steer.
We mourn the chatter, your absence cuts like a knife,
Quiet descends, but your echoes, we still hear.
